results.title: Love me, love my dog
results.brief_description: In Great Britain each year 70,000 accidents and 3,000 human casualties are caused by dogs on the roads, and we see how Barbara Woodhouse and the Croxley Canine Training Society train dogs and their owners in road safety.

results.title: Love is in the air. Eps. 4 & 5
results.creator_credit: Paul Clarke, Richard Stomps, Tony Wyzenbeek and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Love is in the air”.
Episode three of “Love is in the air” looks at the imprecise science of success in the pop music business. A large focus is on Kylie Mingoue, a phenomenally successful pop artist who has reinvented herself numerous times through her stellar career. Other artists such as Todd Hunter (from “Dragon”) talk about the self-destructive streak within the band that sabotaged potential worldwide success; a sentiment echoed by James Freud from “The Models”. Another artist examined in John Farnham, whose early success meant he was poison to radio stations for a time, but whose music won out through the persistence of his manager Glenn Wheatly. Also examines the succes of bands “Air supply”, “Crowded house” and “Savage garden”. Interviewees include Michael Gudinski, Glenn Wheatly, Nick Seymour, Darren Hayes and Kylie. Episode 4 (final) celebrates some of the greatest Australian songs and their writers, the stories behind which illustrate the ephemeral nature of pop songwriting. Interviewees include: James Reyne, Mark Seymour, Neil Finn, Richard Clapton and John Paul Young. An interesting and illuminating series.

results.title: Love is in the air. Eps. 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Richard Stomps, Tony Wyzenbeek and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Love is in the air”.
Episode 1 “The Last Gig on Earth”: In the late 1950s and early 1960s big name international performing artists came from overseas to Australian shores and made lots of money for themselves and their Australian promoters. These talented performers not only shocked conservative Australian society with some of their personal antics but also served to inspire Australian artists to write and perform themselves. The start of the Australian popular music industry was born of copycat performances until we found our own voice. Some of the featured artists and people are: Little Richard, Mick Jagger, Joe Cocker, Johnny Ray, Franck Sinatra and Harry M. Miller. This episode written and produced by Richard Stomps. Episode 2 “She’s leaving home”: Helen Reddy was one of the talented and influential women who paved the way for other Australian women to make it big in the international pop scene. Hugely successful with over 14 songs in the American top 40 alone, Reddy was able to weather the tall poppy critics in Australia to pursue her career. Women have been Australia’s most consistently successful musical export as evidenced by this fascinating documentary. Some of the featured artists are: Helen Reddy, Lana Cantrall, Marcia Hines, Patsy Anne Noble, Renee Geyer, Olivia Newton-John, Pat Carroll, Debra Byrne. This episode written by Claire Hedger and produced by Tony Wyzenbeek. Series narrated by Toni Collette.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Stomps, Tony Wyzenbeek and Australian Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Love is in the air. Ep. 3
results.creator_credit: Greg Appel, Paul Clarke and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Love is in the air”.
Love is in the air is an entertaining series about the history of Australian music on television. This episode largely celebrates the great ABC pop show from the 1970s “Countdown”. Coming out of left field “Countdown” was a deliberate attempt by national broadcaster ABC to court teenagers, and they responded with gusto. The show became so enormously popular that it gained iconic status; whilst at the same time gave many acts their big break. Such acts, featured on this episode include: Sherbet, Skyhooks, John Paul Young, Marcia Hines, and Split Enz. “Countdown” also attracted high-calibre international guests like Elton John, Rod Steward and Madonna. Ian “Molly” Meldrum the show’s irreverent presenter and talent scout became an international personality. Australian variety television shows of the 1950s, and 1960s, celebrating yodelling, slap-stick and vaudevillian artists, paved the way for “Countdown”, which certainly shared with its predecessors an anarchic spirit, and passion for showcasing distinctly Australian culture. Made up of an array of interviews from past alumni, this episode features a heap of excerpts from the “Countdown”, including memorable clips, songs and interviews.

results.title: Love is in the air
results.creator_credit: Paul Clarke and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Using archival footage and contemporary interviews, this fascinating five part series tells of the history of popular music in Australia. Not only did some home-grown stars and songs make it big locally but proved to be just as successful overseas - especially Australian women.

results.title: Love is a planned family
results.creator_credit: Richard Tyson, Richard Tyson, MD and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Documents the viewpoints of several individuals on family planning and methods of birth control, revealing that they are motivated by love - by a very deep concern for their families, including members yet unborn. Interwoven with the why of family planning is a discussion of the effectiveness of birth control methods. The pill, spermicidal foam, IUD, rhythm, diaphragm and condom are among those covered.

results.title: Love in a Cold Climate
results.creator_credit: Tom Hooper, Kate Harwood and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Love In A Cold Climate is the story of three girls and their journey into adulthood. What is most important to Polly, Fanny and Linda is their launching into society where they hope to meet future husbands and fall in love along the way. Set in England in the early 1930’s we meet the eccentric families of the girls and travel between the country houses of England to the drawing rooms of London’s high society all in the pursuit of love. Cast includes Elisabeth Dermot-Walsh, Rosamund Pike, Megan Dodds, Anthony Andrews, Alan Bates.

results.title: Love from Guy
results.creator_credit: Sandra Lepore, Carolyn Johnson and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Played out as a series of video confessions, Love from Guy follows the downward trajectory of Guy (Angelo d’Angelo) a likable but conflicted young man from an Italian background. After Guy’s wife walks out on him, he tries to piece together the reasons why she left by recording a video letter intended for her. Director Sandra Lepore’s short drama explores the ambivalence felt by the protagonist as he tries to reconcile his family’s background and conflicting values which are wrecking havoc on his relationship. Cast includes Les Chantery, Francesca Radice, George Rubiu, Gina Bortolin.
